62.question: What biases are found in the dataset?

3-Table1-1.png: The table contains the number of times ethnicity/race was mentioned per category in the dataset. The average is expressed as a percentage of the number of descriptions. The last column shows the number of descriptions containing an ethnic/racial marker. The table does not provide information on the biases present in the dataset.

The dataset exhibits a bias towards white babies, with an average of 20% of descriptions containing an ethnic/racial marker. Additionally, there is a bias towards AA babies, with an average of 1% of descriptions containing an ethnic/racial marker. There is also a bias towards white baby strollers, with an average of 1% of descriptions containing an ethnic/racial marker.
